title: Nadine Coyle 'signs up' for I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!
text:
Former Girls Aloud singer Nadine Coyle is reportedly headed for a stint in the Jungle as she is the latest famous face to sign-up for this year's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!

The Derry native, 34, is the ninth celebrity 'confirmed' for the beloved ITV series Down Under alongside MIC’s Jamie Laing, ex-rugby star James Haskell and Coronation Street actress Lucy Fallon.

According to The Sun on Sunday, I'm A Celeb producers are hoping that the Northern Irish singer will tell all about Girls Aloud's falling out after they split for good in 2013 and her turbulent relationship with former bandmate Cheryl, 36.

Jungle bound: Former Girls Aloud singer Nadine Coyle is reportedly headed for a stint in the Jungle as she is the latest famous face to sign-up for this year's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!

A TV insider told the publication: 'Nadine is a big name and ITV was keen to get her.

'Her link to Cheryl makes her an even more exciting prospect. It’s no secret there’s no love lost between them, and Nadine is refreshingly honest about what went on from her perspective.

'And I’m a Celebrity could well be the start of something big again for her.'

MailOnline have contacted Nadine Coyle, Cheryl and I'm A Celebrity reps for comment.

However, Nadine has tried to downplay rumours that she and Cheryl clashed during their Girls Aloud days and in 2017 insisted there was no bad blood between them.

Banding together: The Promise hitmakers formed on Popstars: The Rivals in 2002, embarked on a hiatus in 2009 before reuniting for their Ten: The Hits Tour four years later and subsequently announcing they had disbanded in March 2013

Jungle fever: The Derry native, 34, is the ninth celebrity 'confirmed' for the beloved ITV series Down Under alongside MIC’s Jamie Laing, ex-rugby star James Haskell and Coronation Street actress Lucy Fallon

When asked about their 'feud' on Loose Women in 2017, Nadine was asked what she would say if she were in the same room as the pop princess, Nadine laughed and replied, 'Say hello!'

'I'd say, "Hello, how are you doing?!" She has a young baby, I have a daughter. I know what it's like when they're that age.'

Since Girls Aloud split in 2013, Cheryl has remained BFFs with bandmates Nicola Roberts and Kimberley Walsh, but drifted apart from Nadine and Sarah Harding.

The Promise hitmakers, who formed on Popstars: The Rivals in 2002, embarked on a hiatus in 2009 before reuniting for their Ten: The Hits Tour four years later and subsequently announcing they had disbanded in March 2013.

Spilling the tea: According to The Sun on Sunday, I'm A Celeb producers are hoping that the Northern Irish singer will tell all about Girls Aloud's falling out after they split for good in 2013

Discuss: Show bosses also hope, she discusses her turbulent relationship with former bandmate Cheryl, 36

Discussing the band's dynamics on The Sun's Bizarre podcast last year, Nadine said there was 'politics' and later added that there was divide although she wanted everyone on the outside to think they were all best friends.

She shared: 'It was fine at the start but there’s always politics in any band.

'It just happened that I always got more vocals than everybody else, so in terms of people wanting their voice heard, that wasn’t happening. ‘And it made people, very bitter. They didn’t like that.'

She continued: 'I really, really wanted that to be, but it just wasn’t how it was. So yeah there was [a divide]. We’re all very, very different characters.'

Dynamic: Since Girls Aloud split in 2013, Cheryl has remained BFFs with bandmates Nicola Roberts and Kimberley Walsh, but drifted apart from Nadine and Sarah Harding (Pictured in 2007)

She later confirmed that there was no friendship when she appeared on Celebrity Juice in October 2018 when comedian Keith Lemon asked: 'I heard that you fell out?'

Nadine replied: 'There was no falling out, there was just no friendship to begin with.'

News of Nadine's new project comes following reports she decided to call it quits with American football star Jason Bell, 41 - who is the father of her five-year-old daughter Anaiya - after realising they were leading separate lives.

The couple first crossed paths when Nadine was working in the U.S. in 2008, and Jason asked her to marry him in 2010 before splitting for the first time a year later

No love lost: She later confirmed that there was no friendship when she appeared on Celebrity Juice in October 2018 when comedian Keith Lemon asked: 'I heard that you fell out?' (Pictured in 2006)

Nadine and Jason soon rekindled their relationship and he asked her to marry him again in 2014, just months before welcoming their daughter Anaiya.

Nadine moved back to Northern Ireland three years ago to raise their daughter nearby her family, however Jason remained in the U.S.

Nadine had often referred to Jason as her husband despite them never marrying.
description: According to The Sun on Sunday , I'm A Celeb producers are hoping that the Northern Irish singer will tell all about Girls Aloud's falling out after they split for good in 2013.
